str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To dig, dig out, excavate. Apparently a primary verb; to 'burrow' in the ground, i.e. Dig.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hide, conceal, lay up. A primary verb; to conceal.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of arguros; silvery, i.e. cash; specially, a silverling.
